business.headline: Sensex, Nifty break losing streak as US Fed rate cut boosts market sentimentsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 426.86 points to end at 84,818.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 140.55 points to 25,898.55.

Eternal stock slides 5% in a month: Should investors worry or look for an entry?The share price has seen sharp swings during the year, hitting a peak of Rs 368.45 on October 15 before correcting in the last quarter.

Why India is the next global hotspot for luxury real estate investmentThe profile of the Indian homebuyer is changing in ways that directly favour the luxury segment. Millennials, who grew up with global exposure, digital access, and rising professional mobility, prefer premium homeownership.

Meesho's stellar debut has Dalal Street abuzz. What should investors watch next?A 50 percent listing pop has put Meesho in the spotlight, yet the real question now is whether its cost edge and logistics scale can hold as the value-ecommerce battle intensifies.

US Fed rate cut: How the move shapes global markets and IndiaThe Fed's third rate cut steadies some nerves and tests others, raising fresh questions on growth, liquidity and currency pressures, but what do these shifting global cues ultimately mean for India?

India's big AI moment as Big Tech gives big snub to TrumpOver the last few weeks, tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon have pledged investments of more than $68 billion (about Rs 6.12 lakh crore), mostly in AI. It is hardly the picture of a 'dead economy' that Trump painted as Big Tech doubles down on India.

Eggoz faces social media heat over viral cancer claims: All you need to knowEggoz Nutrition, a brand that has built its reputation on selling fresh, chemical-free eggs, found itself at the centre of a storm.

Silver shines brighter than gold: Is the Rs 2 lakh mark now within reach?Silver prices have already scaled fresh highs around Rs 1.93 lakh, supported by surging industrial demand, a softer dollar and a wave of technical breakouts that analysts say could push the metal higher in the coming sessions.

ITR refunds running late? Here's why many taxpayers are waiting longer this yearTaxpayers have reported delays in receiving income tax refunds, with many cases marked as 'under processing' for months. Experts say stricter scrutiny, data mismatches, and a heavy processing backlog are the main factors behind the slowdown.

Sensex, Nifty edge higher as markets react to US Fed rate cutBenchmark indices in India showed modest gains following the US Federal Reserve's third rate cut of the year. Analysts recommend caution despite easing volatility, citing both global and technical factors that could impact market direction.

Large vs mid vs small cap: What makes sense for your money in a falling marketExperts expect small-cap and mid-cap stocks to outperform as the broader market stabilises. Since most retail investors hold a larger share of their portfolios in these two categories, any rebound is likely to directly benefit them.

Intel's deals helped boost CEO Lip-Bu Tan's personal fortune, says reportThe report detailed how Tan's dual roles as Intel's CEO and a venture capitalist have led to potential conflicts of interest involving several of his portfolio companies.

India offering best-ever trade deal, but tough nut to crack: US officialThe US and India have opened critical trade talks in New Delhi, with India presenting its best market access offer yet, according to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer. The discussions aim to resolve tariff disputes and firm up a trade deal between the two countries.

US Fed cuts rates for third time in a row: What it means for your moneyThe US Federal Reserve reduced its key interest rate for the third time in a row on Wednesday. It also signalled that it may leave rates unchanged in the coming months.

Reforms and young talent are powering India's growth, say expertsThe country's strong GDP growth and controlled inflation are "great reasons to rejoice", adding that robust macro factors are also helping stabilise labour markets and household well-being, said the expert.

Air India admits compliance culture needs overhaul after flying Airbus without permitAir India last week called the Airbus November incident "regrettable" and said that some people had been suspended, while India's civil aviation watchdog DGCA ordered the aircraft to be grounded and called for an investigation.

Markets trade in red: Is this the right entry point for long-term investors?India's stock market has been one of the weakest performers globally in 2025 so far. The Sensex has delivered just 1.9% returns, making it the worst performer among 17 major global indices, while the Nifty 50 has risen only 3.2%.
Sensex closes 275 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 275.01 points to close at 84,391.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 81.65 points to end at 25,758.00.

US delegation in Delhi, trade pact talks making headway: Piyush GoyalCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced steady progress in India-US trade talks with the US team visiting New Delhi. The agreement aims to resolve tariff disputes and significantly expand bilateral trade by 2030.

entertainment.headline: Kangana Ranaut mourns Dharmendra: He came from a small village, just like me Actor and politician Kangana Ranaut attended the prayer meeting for late Bollywood icon Dharmendra in New Delhi on December 11. At the gathering, she spoke about his inspiring journey and expressed support for his family.

Huma Qureshi on paparazzi: We use them when we need to promote our films Actor Huma Qureshi shared insights into her nuanced relationship with the paparazzi at Agenda Aaj Tak 2025. She also spoke about her career challenges, not being part of any industry group and a new production venture.

Nawazuddin shuts down talk of rift with Irrfan Khan: That was just news Nawazuddin Siddiqui has dismissed long-standing speculation regarding a rift with Irrfan Khan. He highlighted that their professional history and personal rapport extended beyond their collaboration in the film 'The Lunchbox'.

Hema Malini hosts prayer meet for Dharmendra in Delhi: Amit Shah, Om Birla attend Hema Malini hosted a prayer meeting for Dharmendra in New Delhi on Thursday. Several prominent figures from the political sphere, including Amit Shah, Om Birla and Kangana Ranaut, along with other personalities, paid their last respects to the veteran actor at the gathering.

Fresh blow to Akhanda 2 as Telangana High Court blocks ticket hike, special shows The premiere shows of Akhanda 2: Thaandavam face uncertainty after the Telangana High Court cancelled ticket price hikes and special shows. Starring Nandamuri Balakrishna, the film is set to hit theatres on December 12.

Padayappa behind-the-scenes video by Soundarya sparks Rajinikanth birthday buzz A day ahead of Rajinikanth's birthday, Soundarya Rajinikanth has shared a special behind-the-scenes video from an interview for 'Padayappa'. The movie is scheduled to re-release in theatres on December 12.

Good Wife 2: Priyamani announces new season of her legal Tamil drama JioHotstar's South Unbound event in Chennai introduced a major lineup of 25 new regional originals, including Good Wife Season 2 with Priyamani. The show also stars Sampath Raj.

MasterChef India comeback: Date, platform and viewing details inside The popular cooking competition show 'MasterChef India' is set to return on Indian television. Featuring judges Vikas Khanna, Ranveer Brar, and Kunal Kapur, the upcoming season adopts the theme 'Pride of India.'

Diljit Dosanjh shares his 4 am routine as he begins new project with Imtiaz Ali Diljit Dosanjh's behind-the-scenes look at his work in Punjab offers insight into his daily routine and the significance of his recent Emmy-nominated film with Imtiaz Ali.

Shah Rukh Khan to meet Lionel Messi in Kolkata on December 13 Shah Rukh Khan has confirmed he will meet football star Lionel Messi during Messi's much-anticipated visit to Kolkata on December 13. The city is preparing for a grand welcome, with several high-profile events and dignitaries expected to attend.

Bigg Boss 19 rivals no more: Pranit and Abhishek reunite, pose for paparazzi Comedian Pranit More and actor Abhishek Bajaj have settled their differences after 'Bigg Boss 19'. The duo recently came together for a friendly get-together in Mumbai following a public fallout during the reality show.

The Devil review: Darshan's film falls flat, offering only disappointmentRelease Date:Thu Dec 11, 2025 The highly anticipated Kannada film The Devil, starring Darshan, released in theatres on December 11. The political drama presents the actor in contrasting shades, set against a loud and messy story.

Rakul on romancing Ajay Devgn in De De Pyaar De 2: Acting is a weird process Actor Rakul Preet Singh spoke about the success of 'De De Pyaar De 2' and her role at Agenda Aaj Tak 2025. She also shared candid views on romancing an older hero and the challenges of age-gap portrayals in films.
Def Leppard in India! UK rock band announces three-city tour. Check dates Popular UK rock band Def Leppard announced a three-city India tour. Check their dates and venues here.

I'd have bought it 25 years ago: Abhishek Bachchan destroys claims of buying award Abhishek Bachchan addressed accusations regarding his award win, emphasising the importance of journalistic responsibility and reflecting on his family's background in journalism.

Alia Bhatt has an inspiring message for young girls after Golden Globe Horizon win Alia Bhatt was honoured with the Golden Globe Horizon Award at the Red Sea International Film Festival in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, recognising her achievements and influence in film. Bhatt shared an inspiring message to aspiring girls, lifting spirits.

Karthi's Vaa Vaathiyaar postponed one day ahead of its release. Here's why The Madras High Court has issued a complete stay on the release of Karthi's Vaa Vaathiyaar due to unpaid debts owed by the film's producer KE Gnanavel Raja to a business creditor. This decision comes just one day before the planned worldwide premiere, leaving the film's future uncertain.

Akhanda 2: Telangana government approves hike in ticket prices, special show The Telangana government has approved higher ticket prices and a special premiere for Akhanda-2 following a legal settlement, paving the way for the film's release on December 12.

Prime Video, ZEE5, JioHotstar: Saali Mohabbat, Fallout 2 and more This week's OTT lineup brings a mix of dark thrillers, superhero action, historical storytelling and post-apocalyptic drama across Prime Video, ZEE5 and JioHotstar. From James Gunn's Superman reboot to the intense Saali Mohabbat and the much-awaited Fallout Season 2, viewers have a diverse set of new titles to explore.

general news.headline: Very warm conversation: PM, Trump discuss trade, defence amid tariff tensionsDuring the conversation, both PM Modi and Trump emphasised the need to maintain momentum in their shared efforts to enhance bilateral trade. Both expressed satisfaction at the steady strengthening of bilateral cooperation across all domains.

Corporate fraud? 42 suspicious firms at same Delhi address linked to Birch ownersA detailed review of documents accessed by India Today reveals that the two brothers are linked to a total of 42 companies, many of which appear to exist only on paper. Corporate records show that the Luthra brothers are listed as directors or partners in 42 different companies and limited liability partnerships (LLPs).

34 killed in Myanmar after military's overnight airstrike destroys hospitalRoughly another 80 people were wounded when the strike hit the general hospital, which sits in an area administered by the Arakan Army.

2nd T20I Live: IND (162-all-out), South Africa win by 51 runs in MullanpurIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) LIVE Score, 2nd T20I: South Africa win the second T20I and level the series 1-1. A superb knock from Quinton de Kock and a disciplined bowling performance help them win the 2nd T20I in Mullanpur.

Several prominent figures from the political sphere, including Amit Shah, Om Birla and Kangana Ranaut, along with other personalities, paid their last respects to the veteran actor at the gathering.

Send back Indian techies, one H-1B worker equals 10 illegal aliens: Top US pollsterUS pollster and political commentator Mark Mitchell claimed senior H‑1B developers at tech firms like Apple are "economically the same as 10 undocumented workers". He also alleged that Americans were being replaced by foreign workers because they are cheaper compared to American workers.

IndiGo's gross mismanagement: Civil Aviation Minister blames airline for flight chaosThe minister's statement came a day after IndiGo Chairman Vikram Mehta broke his silence on the matter and tendered an apology to passengers for the unprecedented trouble they faced over the last few days.

To de-Indianise US companies, top pollster Mark Mitchell plans to start consultancyMark Mitchell, CEO of a leading US polling firm, Rasmussen Reports, has criticised the H-1B visa programme, saying he wants to launch a consultancy to "de-Indianise" American companies. His comments come amid renewed scrutiny of foreign tech workers under Trump's second term.

Strange blue light appeared over Japan during M7.6 Aomori earthquakeThe eerie glow, captured on several mobile phone cameras, has reignited global curiosity about a rare natural phenomenon known as earthquake lights (EQL).

Amit Shah under pressure, used wrong language: Rahul Gandhi on Parliament showdownRahul Gandhi claimed Amit Shah appeared "under a lot of mental pressure" as the Lok Sabha debate on electoral reforms spiralled into a confrontation, accusing the Home Minister of using "wrong language".

Furious Gautam Gambhir caught on camera after Arshdeep bowls 7 wides in an overIND vs SA: Head coach Gautam Gambhir lost his cool as Arshdeep Singh bowled seven wides to complete the 11th over against South Africa on Thursday in Mullanpur.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

120 Bahadur flops, Dhurandhar soars: A lesson in patriotism psychologyTwo films, worlds apart in box office fate, highlight India's patriotism divide: audiences crave cathartic dominance over painful remembrance.

Sudha Murty wants Vande Mataram mandated in schools. But should it be compulsory?Sudha Murty has urged the government to make singing Vande Mataram compulsory in all schools. The song has historical value and national pride, but daily compulsory singing ignores context, pressure on curriculum, and the diversity of today's classrooms.
Menodivorce: Is menopause pushing more women out of marriages?Can menopause cause a divorce? Experts aren't ruling it out entirely.

The Devil review: Darshan's film falls flat, offering only disappointmentRelease Date:Thu Dec 11, 2025The highly anticipated Kannada film The Devil, starring Darshan, released in theatres on December 11. The political drama presents the actor in contrasting shades, set against a loud and messy story.

How one Modi-Putin selfie is spooking White House, CongressThe Modi-Putin selfie in a Toyota Fortuner has become a diplomatic weapon, and the US has noticed. While Washington is continuously pressuring India with tariffs and an H-1B crackdown, India-Russia ties are only growing stronger. The image now symbolises the US' missteps that got New Delhi and Moscow even closer.

Everyone was criticising our team: Jemimah says WPL fuelled India's World Cup pushJemimah Rodrigues credited the Women's Premier League for elevating India's performance and helping them win the historic Women's World Cup. Shafali Verma, meanwhile, called for pay parity at the domestic level to better nurture the next generation of women cricketers.

PM to visit Jordan, Ethiopia and Oman from December 15 to 18The tour will focus on strengthening bilateral ties, marking key diplomatic anniversaries and boosting cooperation across trade, security and regional issues.

Vande Mataram to SIR, who won the Sansad showdown? Democratic Newsroom debatesIn this edition of Democratic Newsroom, the focus is on the fiery debates on Vande Mataram and the electoral reforms between the government and the Opposition in the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament.

The red meat cancer scare is misleading. Here's what science actually showsFrom Japan to India, new evidence challenges the viral belief that red meat drives colon cancer. Doctors say fear, not facts, is shaping the narrative.

Don't travel to India: Experts warn H-1B visa holders amid interview reschedulingImmigration attorneys have urged H-1B visa holders not to travel to India after the mass postponement of visa interviews from December to March and April 2026. They are suggesting that H-1B visa holders be in the US. Those travelling could risk losing jobs and being separated from families.

Bangladesh to hold polls on Feb 12, 2026, first since Sheikh Hasina's ousterBangladesh will hold its 13th National Parliamentary Election on February 12, 2026, the first general polls since Sheikh Hasina's ouster, alongside a national referendum.

18 dead after truck falls into gorge near India-China border in ArunachalThe labourers were travelling in a dumper engaged in a local construction project when it veered off the mountainous stretch and rolled down nearly 1,000 feet.

sports.headline: Kolkata Ready for Messi: 70ft Statue, SRK and Sourav Ganguly to Welcome Legend In this Special Report, India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on Kolkata's grand preparations for Lionel Messi. The football icon arrives on Saturday for a historic visit. A 70-foot statue, commissioned by West Bengal Minister Sujit Basu and crafted by artist Monty Pal, awaits him. The reporter notes, 'The football crazy city Kolkata is all gearing up for the grand welcome.' The main event at Vivekananda Yuvabharti Krirangan will see Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, Sourav Ganguly, and Shah Rukh Khan felicitate the legend.

Failed experiments, De Kock carnage: South Africa level series as India capitulate Quinton de Kock's carnage with the bat and failed experiments saw India crumble to a disappointing loss in the second T20I in Mullanpur on Thursday, December 11.

Why send Axar at No. 3? Indian team management slammed for batting order shuffle India coach Gautam Gambhir's decision to promote Axar Patel up the order backfired spectacularly in the second T20I against South Africa in Mullanpur, triggering widespread criticism and fresh scrutiny of the team's muddled batting approach.

Shubman Gill fails again: Fans accuse Gambhir of favouritism in India's T20I team IND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Shubman Gill failed to open his account in the Mullanpur T20I after Lungi Ngidi claimed his crucial wicket. Fans lashed out at Gautam Gambhir and the selection panel for favouritism.

Mullanpur horror for Bumrah, Arshdeep: India pacers leaks runs, go wicketless Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh had a rare off day at the office as both men went wicketless and leaked runs against South Africa in the second T20I in Mullanpur. South Africa ended up scoring 213 as the Indian bowlers struggled with dew.

Everyone was criticising our team: Jemimah says WPL fuelled India's World Cup push Jemimah Rodrigues credited the Women's Premier League for elevating India's performance and helping them win the historic Women's World Cup. Shafali Verma, meanwhile, called for pay parity at the domestic level to better nurture the next generation of women cricketers.

Jitesh Sharma conjures magic behind stumps to deny Quinton de Kock hundred IND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Jitesh Sharma conjured a stunning piece of wicketkeeping to halt Quinton de Kock's blazing innings and deny the South African opener what appeared to be a certain hundred in the second T20I in Mullanpur on Thursday.

Furious Gautam Gambhir caught on camera after Arshdeep bowls 7 wides in an over IND vs SA: Head coach Gautam Gambhir lost his cool as Arshdeep Singh bowled seven wides to complete the 11th over against South Africa on Thursday in Mullanpur.

No handshakes again? ICC reveals stance for India vs Pakistan U19 Asia Cup clash The ICC has revealed their stance for the upcoming India vs Pakistan clash in the U19 Asia Cup as the handshake debate resurfaces. Indian players have refused to shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts in major tournaments since the Pahalgam terror attack.

Yuvraj Singh and Harmanpreet Kaur stands unveiled at Mullanpur Stadium IND vs SA: Yuvraj Singh and Harmanpreet Kaur had stadium stands named after them at the Mullanpur venue on December 11, where Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann felicitated the two stars.

Overprepared? McCullum's Ashes claim called tone deaf by former England captainFormer England captain Michael Atherton slammed Brendon McCullum's claim of overpreparing for the pink-ball Test as a bit tone deaf. England were comprehensively beaten during the pink-ball Test.

Kohli, Pant named in Delhi's provisional squad for Vijay Hazare TrophyVirat Kohli and Rishabh Pant have been named in the Delhi provisional squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy, the DDCA announced on Thursday, December 11.

T20 World Cup 2026 tickets go live: Where to buy, how much they costThe International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced that ticket sales for the T20 World Cup 2026 will go live on Thursday, with fans able to purchase them via https://tickets.cricketworldcup.com.

Amid rumours of sacking, Real Madrid stars back manager Xabi AlonsoReal Madrid stars Rodrygo, Jude Bellingham and Thibaut Courtois came to the defence of Xabi Alonso as the Real Madrid boss is under serious scrutiny. Rumours are suggesting that Alonso's position is under serious scrutiny after a string of poor results.

2nd T20I Live: IND (162-all-out), South Africa win by 51 runs in MullanpurIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) LIVE Score, 2nd T20I: South Africa win the second T20I and level the series 1-1. A superb knock from Quinton de Kock and a disciplined bowling performance help them win the 2nd T20I in Mullanpur.

Is Gautam Gambhir right about batting orders being overrated? De Villiers weighs inAB de Villiers weighed in on India coach Gautam Gambhir's comment that batting orders in white-ball cricket are overrated. Gambhir made the remark following India's ODI series win against South Africa recently.

Shafali Verma: World Cup snub was tough, but god rewarded me for hard workShafali Verma missed out on India's initial Women's World Cup squad but came in as a replacement and went on to win the Player of the Match award in the final against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

Jemimah says jam with Sunil Gavaskar soon, makes promise at Agenda AajTakAgenda AajTak: Jemimah Rodrigues said she will soon join the legendary Sunil Gavaskar for a jamming session. The Indian batter recently played a key role in helping India win the Women's World Cup.

After backing Usman Khawaja to open again, Michael Clarke makes shocking U-turnFormer Australia captain Michael Clarke has performed a shocking U-turn in terms of Usman Khawaja returning to the top of the order for Australia in the Adelaide Test. Khawaja is fit and ready to play a part in the third Test.

Violent clash at a football match in Karachi leaves players and officials injuredA tense National Games semi-final in Karachi turned ugly as tempers boiled over, sparking a mass fight that has forced Pakistan's football authorities into action.

Kolkata Knight Riders IPL auction strategy explained: 5 players KKR can targetKolkata Knight Riders have hit the reset button hard as they have gone for a big revamp by releasing some major names before the auction. With a big purse and a lot of cash to burn, expect KKR to be the busiest team during the auction on December 16.

Remembering Sachin's Ranji debut: When Gavaskar, even retired, timed it rightThirty-seven years on, Sachin Tendulkar's Ranji debut remains frozen in Mumbai's cricketing memory. A 15-year-old schoolboy struck a century on debut, rewarding Sunil Gavaskar's instinct to be in the stands to watch the much-talked-about wunderkind play senior cricket for the first time.

NZ vs WI: Mitch Hay steps up on debut as New Zealand tighten grip on second TestNZ vs WI, 2nd Test Day 2: Mitch Hay's composed 61 on debut helped New Zealand post 278 in reply to West Indies' 205, before late wickets left the tourists 32-2 and still 41 runs behind at stumps. A weakened Kiwi attack faces a stern test after Blair Tickner's injury on Day 1.

Travis Head's podcast comment hints at Australia's opening plans for Adelaide TestThe Ashes 2025-26: Travis Head may have hinted at Australia's plans for the Adelaide Test as Usman Khawaja pushes to prove his fitness, leaving selectors with a key decision at the top of the order.

Did Gautam Gambhir ignore Ro-Ko after ODI series win? Ex-teammate sparks fresh rowAfter India's ODI series victory over South Africa, Robin Uthappa expressed surprise at head coach Gautam Gambhir for not crediting Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, despite their standout performances. Kohli amassed 302 runs, including two hundreds, in the three-match series, which India won 2-1.

Seattle's Pride game with anti-LGBTQ nations Egypt and Iran creates problems for FIFASeattle's plan to celebrate Pride during a World Cup match has triggered strong protests from Egypt and Iran, placing FIFA in the middle of a global cultural dispute.

The unflinching 15 minutes: How India staged a historic comeback to win bronzeJunior Hockey World Cup 2025: India's 4–2 comeback against Argentina secured a significant bronze and highlighted the group's depth, resolve and improving game awareness. The win offers reassurance about the junior team's development and the promise they carry as they progress toward senior hockey.

It's not Sanju Samson vs Jitesh Sharma. It's Sanju Samson vs Shubman GillIndia vs South Africa: India's opening equation remains unsettled, with Shubman Gill short of runs and Sanju Samson short of opportunities. As the World Cup approaches, clarity in selection will prove decisive in determining whether the champions enter their title defence with stability or lingering uncertainty.

Watch: Erling Haaland fires playful jibe at Carragher amid Liverpool's Salah crisisErling Haaland aimed a playful jab at Jamie Carragher amid the pundit's ongoing Salah controversy as Manchester City secured a 2-1 Champions League win over Real Madrid at the Bernabeu.

Shahid Afridi sparks feud with Gautam Gambhir: He thought whatever he says is rightShahid Afridi has reignited his long-standing feud with Gautam Gambhir, accusing the current Indian coach of having an attitude. Afridi also backed Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to continue until the 2027 ODI World Cup, calling them the backbone of India's batting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
